str2: (a thing proved, hence) a plain token (sign, proof). From endeiknumi; an indication.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.
Decision; by extension, a tribunal; by implication, justice.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
To deem (count) worthy. From kata and axioo; to deem entirely deserving.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Feminine Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill treatment, suffer.
